texts.value: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of the ketose sugar fructose to fructose-1-phosphate
Most abundant in liver, kidney, gut, spleen and pancreas. Low levels also found in adrenal, muscle, brain and eye
The disease is caused by variants affecting the gene represented in this entry
More widely distributed but with a low expression level. KM=7 mM for D-fructose (at 25 degrees Celsius). KM=036 mM for Mg-ATP (at 25 degrees Celsius). kcat is 6.9 sec(-1)
Belongs to the carbohydrate kinase PfkB family

features.description: in FRUCT; loss of ketohexokinase function; insoluble; dbSNP:rs104893643
in FRUCT; no effect on ketohexokinase function; decreases enzyme activity but no effect in substrate affinity; decreases thermal stability; dbSNP:rs104893644
